title: 8-bit Diamond Block
description: Make a diamond block with loops.

steps.hint: We’ll use two loops for the stone. **Type** `for x in [0 ... 16]`
We’ll use a randomly chosen shade of gray to make the stone. **Type** `color darken gray, random -6, 9`
Move into position for each square with `moveTo x * 31.25, y * 31.25`
Finally, draw the stone square with `square 32`
Get out of the loop by bringing your cursor to the beginning of the line with **BACKSPACE**. We’ll start a new pair of loops to draw the diamond. **Type** `for x in [2 ... 14]`
This time we are starting at 2 and ending at 14 because we only want the diamond to appear in the middle of the block. **Type** `for y in [2 ... 14]`
The diamond should appear randomly, this if statement will only randomly draw the diamond. **Type** `if 1 == random 0, 4`
Set the diamond color with `color lighten lightblue, random 0, 40`
Move into position for each square with `moveTo x * 31.25, y * 31.25`
Finally, draw the diamond square with `square 32`

completion_text: You’ve completed an hour of code! What’s next? More challenges and 8-bit art projects here at Kano if you are interested. Congratulations and well done!
